alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Pennington Co Plains (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 5:10PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson and southeastern Pennington Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 509 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southeast of Pinnacles Ranger Station, or 31 miles southwest of Philip, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Interior and Cedar Pass. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm is producing large quantities of hail. Driving through deep hail is like driving on slushy roads. Slow down and do not brake suddenly.
